description: React Single Page Application patterns and best practices
author: VIBE IDE Team

stateManagement.global: Context API or Redux for app-wide state

routing.pattern: Declarative routing with Routes and Route

dataFetching.pattern: useEffect with async/await or custom hooks

aiSuggestions.context: You are helping create a React Single Page Application. Common patterns include: functional components with hooks (useState, useEffect, useContext), React Router for navigation, controlled forms, async data fetching with useEffect, component composition, props drilling vs Context API, conditional rendering, list rendering with keys. Always use functional components, not class components. Remember to include dependencies in useEffect dependency arrays to avoid stale closures. Use React.memo for expensive components. Always provide keys when rendering lists.

commonBugs: Missing dependencies in useEffect - Causes stale closures and infinite loops
Forgetting to return cleanup function - Causes memory leaks
Mutating state directly - Always use setState, never mutate state
Missing keys in lists - Causes React rendering issues
Infinite re-renders - Check useEffect dependencies and state updates
Event handler not bound - Use arrow functions or bind in class components
Async state updates - Use functional setState for updates based on previous state
performanceTips: Use React.memo for expensive components that don't change often
Use useCallback for functions passed as props
Code split with React.lazy and Suspense
Virtualize long lists with react-window or react-virtualized
Avoid creating objects/arrays in render - move to useState or useMemo
Use production build for better performance

bestPractices.components: One component per file, named exports
bestPractices.hooks: Custom hooks in hooks/ folder, prefix with 'use'
bestPractices.state: Lift state up when shared, use Context for global state
